definitions.definition: Used in comparisons, to introduce the basis of comparison.
examples: she's taller than I am;  she found his advice more witty than helpful;  we have less work today than we had yesterday;  We had no (other) choice than to return home;  I love you more than (what) she does, but less than he, or than I do your sisters.
City dwellers have a higher cancer rate than do countrymen. Apparently, they drink more than is good for 'em.

definitions.label_groups: obsolete outside dialects , usually used with for

main_definition: Used in comparisons, to introduce the basis of comparison.
secondary_definitions: ( obsolete outside dialects , usually used with for ) Because ; for .
